p: In another study from Perry County, Kentucky, a rural area at the center of the current opioid overdose crisis, Stone and colleagues find that the risks associated with incarceration may contribute up to 43% of new HCV infections over the next decade ( Stone,Â Fraser, Young, Havens & Vickerman, 2020). To reduce this risk, their analyses show that OST and NSP need to be scaled up in the community, combined with prison-based OST and retention on release. Importantly, they also find that decriminalization plus diversion to OST could prevent over half of new HCV infections in the next ten years, underscoring the substantial benefit that drug policy reform could have in the U.S.
